subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Unable to earn her card through sponsor exemptions, Michelle Wie has entered the L.P.G.A. Tour qualifying school and will play the first stage next week on the California course where she first rose to fame at 13. Her father, B. J. Wie, had said at the United States Women’s Open that Wie had “no other options” but Q-school if she did not make enough money to finish the equivalent of 80th on the L.P.G.A. Tour money list. The first stage will be at Mission Hills in Rancho Mirage, Calif., site of the Kraft Nabisco Championship, where Wie played in the final group of the L.P.G.A.’s first major when she was in the eighth grade.
